docs.title: Context Engineering - What it is? Why it matters?
docs.text:
Context is everything fed to the LLM during inference. This includes: - The instructions -the prompt - Retrieved facts (e.g. with vector search) - history of the conversation (e.g. chat history) - tool outputs (e.g. API responses)

Where prompt engineering is used to craft the instruction text, context engineering architects the whole information flow -data, tools, memory, ranking and budgets.

References:

  • 2507 A Survey of Context Engineering for Large Language Models

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The AI Prime Directive organizes patterns across foundations, RAG, agents & memory, evals, and product/UX.

Each page follows a consistent pattern-card structure: When to use, Architecture sketch, Pitfalls, Checklist, Good–Better–Best, and a tiny eval snippet.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • Agent Memory

docs.title: See also
docs.text: • RAG 2.0 — Agentic RAG

docs.title: When to use
docs.text: Multi-step tasks with evolving user intent, preferences, or constraints.

docs.title: Architecture sketch
docs.text:
Input → Scratchpad (ephemeral) → Tools
      → Profile (long-term) → Ledger (task)

docs.title: Pitfalls
docs.text:
• Storing everything forever → privacy and drift
  • Missing expiry windows and provenance

docs.title: Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Define memory types and retention windows
  • [ ] Source-of-truth + PII handling
  • [ ] Summarization with confidence and citations

docs.title: Good–Better–Best
docs.text:
• Good: ephemeral scratchpad
  • Better: task ledger with rollups
  • Best: governed profile with consent and expiry

docs.title: Tiny eval snippet
docs.text:
def recall_rate(prompts, memory):
    return sum(int(intent in memory) for intent in prompts) / len(prompts)

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • EvalOps (Overview)

docs.title: When to use
docs.text: Always. Start tiny, grow with coverage.

docs.title: Architecture sketch
docs.text: Suites → Runner → Scores → Gates → Dashboards

docs.title: Pitfalls
docs.text:
• Vibes over metrics
  • Only aggregate metrics without slices

docs.title: Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Golden set with categories and slices
  • [ ] Prompt + retrieval snapshots
  • [ ] Regression gates in CI/CD

docs.title: Good–Better–Best
docs.text:
• Good: manual runs on a small set
  • Better: CI hook + dashboards
  • Best: canary deploy + feedback loops

docs.title: Tiny eval snippet
docs.text:
def pass_fail(scores, threshold=0.7):
    return sum(int(s>=threshold) for s in scores) / len(scores)

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: • Graph RAG

docs.title: See also
docs.text: • RAG 2.0 — Agentic RAG

docs.title: When to use
docs.text: When relationships matter more than raw text: compliance, research, multi-hop questions.

docs.title: Architecture sketch
docs.text:
Text → NER/RE → Triples → Graph DB
Query (entities/paths) → Retrieve → Compose → Evals

docs.title: Pitfalls
docs.text:
• Noisy extraction → brittle paths
  • Over-indexing without clear query policies

docs.title: Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Define entity/edge schema
  • [ ] Extraction evals on representative corpus
  • [ ] Hybrid retrieve: graph paths + text

docs.title: Good–Better–Best
docs.text:
• Good: simple entity linking
  • Better: typed relations and path constraints
  • Best: learned policies + feedback loops

docs.title: Tiny eval snippet
docs.text:
def path_coverage(query, graph_paths):
    return any(required_edge in p for p in graph_paths)

docs.title: Hybrid RAG
docs.text: Outline what to mix (keyword, dense, graph), selection policies, and fallbacks.

docs.title: Pitfalls
docs.text:
• Unclear selection policies → inconsistent results
  • Over-fetching → latency and cost

docs.title: Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Define routing criteria (by query intent)
  • [ ] Instrument retrieval choices and outcomes
  • [ ] Add evals per route (e.g., factuality, coverage)

docs.title: When to use
docs.text: When domain knowledge is too large or dynamic to fit in context windows, and correctness matters.

docs.title: Architecture sketch
docs.text:
Ingest → Chunk → Enrich (entities, tables) → Index
             ↓                     ↑
         Policies ← Query → Retrieve → Compose → Evals

docs.title: Pitfalls
docs.text:
• Over-chunking without semantic boundaries
  • Unenriched tables/figures → hallucinated facts
  • Missing retrieval policies (filters, recency, diversity)

docs.title: Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Ground-truth set covering key intents
  • [ ] Chunking with structure awareness (headings, tables)
  • [ ] Enrichment: entities, citations, table extraction
  • [ ] Retrieval policies + diversity
  • [ ] Compose with citations and abstain behavior

docs.title: Good–Better–Best
docs.text:
• Good: naive vector search, simple compose
  • Better: hybrid retrieval, citations, abstain
  • Best: structured enrichments, policies, evaluators per intent

docs.title: Tiny eval snippet

def evaluate(query, answer, gold):
    return int(citation_present(answer) and contains(gold, answer))
